item.title: Installation of Kubernetes on Debian
item.description:
Rationale

At work, we are currently deploying GKEs for our applications. Today, containerization is no longer something I see as optional but a necessity due to the value it provides—though it’s often necessary to work on team organization first to get the most out of it, but that’s a topic for another post.

However, mastering such a system is not within everyone’s reach. Implementing technical governance around this system is no easy task, and those who implement it generally agree—it’s complex and requires real expertise to design and deploy the various stacks with technology choices suited to the context.

item.title: About me
item.description:
About Me

I’m just an IT guy who started my journey with the QNX operating system—long before I ever used Windows. I learned a lot working with QNX, and for those who remember the Photon Desktop Manager, it was truly ahead of its time!

Eventually, Windows came along, but I quickly transitioned to FreeBSD. I ended up using both systems for quite a while. I spent many years as a sysadmin before moving into project management. Today, I’m a Project Director, which has taken me far from the technical side of things.
